cyclone.name: LAURA
cyclone.current_location: about 15 miles south of Cayo Largo, Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: Forecast to turn northwest on Tuesday and track across the central and north-western Gulf of Mexico toward the Texas/Louisiana border coastline
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: north-west Gulf Coast near the Texas-Louisiana border (east of Galveston)

weather_observation.watch_coast: None at 200 PM EDT advisory; watches are anticipated later for the northwest Gulf Coast
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northwest Gulf Coast from the upper Texas coast through south-central Louisiana
weather_observation.wind: Up to 51 % chance of sustained tropical-storm-force winds (≥34 kt) and a 9 % chance of hurricane-force winds at Galveston between late Wednesday night and Thursday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Potential for life-threatening storm surge of at least 3–6 ft along the upper Texas coast and in Galveston Bay if the track shifts toward Texas.
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches of rain with isolated totals near 12 inches possible Thursday into Friday, producing flash-flood potential in the Galveston/Houston area.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf, rip currents, and the possibility of isolated tornadoes in the coastal plain as outer rain-bands move onshore.
